text: __NOTOC__ Frantz Charlet (1862–1928) was a Belgian painter, etcher, and lithographer. ==Early life and career== An Impressionist, he was one of the founding members of the group Les XX. He studied at the Académie Royale des Beaux-Arts in Brussels from 1872 until 1873 and again from 1876 to 1881; among his fellow pupils there were Eugène Broerman, François-Joseph Halkett, Théo van Rysselberghe and Rodolphe Wytsman, and his teacher was Jean-François Portaels. ==Gallery== File:Franz Charlet 001.jpg| Young girl, oil painting File:CursalOstende 055.jpg|Cursal d'Ostende, 1922, Musée d'Ixelles File:Frantz Charlet - Die Goldenen Häuser von Brügge.jpeg|Die Goldenen Häuser von Brügge, oil on canvas ==See also== *Les XX ==References== *Frantz Charlet at artnet ==External links== * Category:1862 births Category:1928 deaths Category:Artists from Brussels Category:Belgian Impressionist painters Category:Belgian etchers Category:Belgian lithographers Category:20th-century printmakers Category:Académie Royale des Beaux-Arts alumni
title: Frantz Charlet
